runs.comm: back of a length outside off and moving away, Shahzaib lets it go.
better line, just outside off and Shahzaib is in no position, half forward, half back and feeling for it as it carries through into AB's gloves chest high

shot. Albie lands it on a good length again, but it was on off stump. Shahzaib has the tendence to reach across to off stump with his trigger movement. This time he got inside the line and clipped it off the pads through square leg.
and a tennis shot this time. Back of a length again, and Shahzaib tries to cross-bat slap it straight from the crease. No timing, and lucky to elude mid on running across
hint of inward movement this time as Farhat reaches out to a fuller delivery and squeezes it off the outside edge to third man for a couple
gets behind the line this time and defends confidently back to the bowler
begins with an inducker straigtening into Shahzaib from off stump and he ends up playing all around his thrust out front pad. Makes contact in the nick of time to pick a single to square leg
shape away from Farhat from well outside off stump. Farhat lets it go
extra bounce from Tsotsobe, who is making a conscious effort to hit the deck hard. Farhat looks to cut but it got big on him and he swished at thin air. Thuds into AB's gloves.
fuller and on the pads, Farhat was late on the shot but managed to check drive to long on for one

Shahzaib is gone, betraying the same technical issues that were on display yesterday. Not even close to driving length as Tsotsobe lands it back of a length and looks to angle it across Shahzaib. As is his wont, Shahzaib plonks the right foot across instead of forward and drives without conviction. Ends up making contact early and scooping it over midwicket. Botha runs back and takes a good catch.
Farhat lets another short ball go outside off to end the over
Hafeez begins with a pleasing bit of timing. Albie lands it back of a length on off stump and Hafeez eases into a cover drive that was more touch than hit. Easy three as it holds up in the outfield
Farhat pushes a length ball straight to mid off for a single, Morne throws the stumps down at the bowler's end, but Farhat is in
another check drive into the covers for a single. That's an improvement from yesterday, when Pakistan struggled to hit second gear, shifting jerkily between first and fifth.
whump. Farhat reaches out and flat-bats a length ball angling across him over mid off. That was timed really well
slower ball, Farhat was waiting and eased it off the face square on the off side
short ball to end the over and Farhat timed the pull shot well, in front of square, but failed to place it away from midwicket
slow inducker at 119 kph coming into Hafeez who leans out and defends gingerly to the leg side

that's been creamed. Hafeez leans his front foot across, gets close to the pitch of an over-pitched ball outside off and then freed his arms to send it flying through the covers. In the air, but he picked the gap to perfection.

another classy shot from Hafeez. Tsotsobe brings it in from off stump and it seemed like there wasn't much Hafeez could do with it except defend. He waited for the movement and then turned the wrists to send it fine and past short fine leg for four
back of a length outside off and Hafeez punches down the ground for a single. Not very well timed
Farhat drives wide of mid off and takes off for another single. Bosman his the stumps again, but Farhat was well in
well bowled, slow off cutter breaking across Hafeez takes his outside edge as he fends outside off, but it does not carry to the solitary slip.
pitched up on middle and leg, Hafeez drives nicely but straight to mid on

and that's the end of Hafeez's innings. Morne holds it back outside off and forces Hafeez to steer from the back foot. Should I cut? Should I steer? Hafeez's mind was not made as the ball took inside edge and rammed into the stumps. On the corridor always does the trick - well bowled by Morne.
shade of away movement to the new batsman from outside off. Misbah plays cautiously off the back foot into the off side
shorter this time and Misbah is more forthright with his footwork as he gets back and steers it to point
Morne gets it to cut into the batsman from outside off and Misbah plays all over it. Dribbles off the pads into the off side
angled into Misbah again, and he gets inside the line and works it straight to square leg

Oh my. Farhat has somehow managed to play a shot uglier than the one he out playing last night. Another slowish off cutter from Tsotsobe, 122 kph, but Farhat's batting apparatus was pre-programmed to go for the shovel over the leg side. It did not seem like he was even looking at the ball. In fact, his eyes were looking at cow corner when he finished his bat swing.. All this well before the ball came through from a length and crashed into leg stump
Umar gets behind the line and defends his first ball to the off side
whoa, 129 kph but that ball took off from a length as Umar reached out and looked to cover drive. Missed his edge though
this one is on the stumps and Umar goes back in the crease to work it off the pads to square leg
Misbah goes back and pushes into the covers to get off the mark with a single

lucky. Tsotsobe's change in pace is having Pakistan in some strife here. This one was floated at 126 kph outside off and Umar was decieved into playing the square drive early. It went in the air, but just away from point and through to the boundary
tossed up and turning in from off to leg, Misbah can't work it past Botha

run out appeal and Umar Akmal is on his way. Shorter and flatter from Misbah who turns it towards long leg. They take a single, but Umar wanted more. He was halfway down when he realised Misbah was not thinking of the suicidal second. He turned back, but could not beat the throw and was well short when AB broke the stumps
well, he bashed the first ball for six yesterday, but chooses a far more non-violent option today. Driven robustly into the covers for one
Misbah stays in the crease and works it back to the bowler
Misbah is getting stuck again, pushed back by a quicker one and he just about gets bat on it and plays it back to Botha
lovely bit of loop and dip from Botha. Slower through the air and Misbah was very early into the shot. Rapped on the pads, but he was well forward and that may have saved him
slow and pitched up on middle, Afridi picks the pace and line early and whips it safely through midwicket for a couple

Despair and dismay as Afridi goes and Pakistan implode spectacularly here. Afridi's eyes light up at an offering floated full and outside off. He looks to square drive and ends up scooping it high instead of far. Deep cover settles under it.
good length, jags in at 127 kph and Misbah was looking prone as he tried to play off the back foot. Somehow manages to get some bat to the leg side and pick a single
Razzaq stays back this time and defends an off cutter back to the bowler
back of a length outside off again and Razzaq stays back to check drive to the off side
finally times one well, crisply off the middle as he plays the backfoot cover drive. There is protection though and the sweeper keeps him to a single
Razzaq plays back to Botha - remember he was owned by a Botha floater yesterday - but picks the spin this time and plays to cover
Misbah plays inside the line to a floater this time and misses outside edging it by a whisker
another floater, and another fumble from Misbah as he closes the face early and gets a leading edge
again a leading edge as he closes the face and picks a single square
Razzaq is decidedly playing back here and plays out a length ball to the off side
tossed up on middle and Razzaq looks to tickle it fine, but can't elude short fine leg
edged and just wide of Botha at slip. Misbah is struggling with balls on a length outside off and ends up fishing unconvincingly again, but this time picks four for his efforts
full on middle and Misbah flicks uppishly through midwicket for one more
back of a length and rising into Razzaq who stays back and steers it through the covers for one
Theron keeps it outside off stump and Misbah looks to run it to the left of point. Can't get it past the fielder though
slips down the leg and it is wide
very slow slower ball, 103 kph, and Misbah waits an eternity before the off cutter reaches him. He eventually works it square on the leg side for one
Razzaq slices and has a slice of luck. Back of a length in the corridor, and like Hafeez, Razzaq was caught amidships with his cut shot. Inside edge somehow misses the stumps and runs to fine leg
flighted on off and Razzaq drives without timing straight to cover
back of a length and coming in, Razzaq waits on the back foot and uses the wrists to work it square on the off side for one
Misbah reaches outside off and works it with the spin to the leg side for one
floater outside off, Razzaq gropes without a clue and misses. AB appeals for a catch, but Razzaq was just not good enough to edge this
another wide, this one slides down the leg
sliding donw the pads again and Razzaq glances it fine but for no runs.
change in angle and change in trajectory. Complete befuddlement. Razzaq flails without conviction as another floater drifts past him from round the wicket.
full on the pads and Misbah flicks it square for a single
off cutter cramps Razzaq completely as he hangs back. Ends up playing it to the leg side without any power and they take the single once Morne fails to stop it on his follow through
sliding down the leg and Misbah glances fine for another single
good bouncer, pushes Razzaq back and forces him to let it go as it whizzes past at good pace and with good carry
another bouncer, whistles past Razzaq who hangs back and does well to let it go
makes contact this time to a ball that was not as short as the previous ones. Razzaq angles it off the face to third man
Razzaq semss blood. He has had enough of the typing down and unfurls a typically robust bash down the ground to a flighted ball that lands well beyond the boundary
he picks a single this time, working it to the leg side
Misbah unfurls a reverse sweep, makes good contact but can't beat short third man
Misbah works this one with the spin behind square leg for one
Botha slides this down the leg, as he looks to deny Razzaq room for another golf swing. Ends up conceding a wide
another one sliding down the leg, but Razzaq makes contact. Can't pick a single though.
works it with the turn to square leg and picks another single. Botha finishes a fine spell. 6 of the 17 runs he conceded came off one ball
Morne pushes Razzaq back with an inducker and Razzaq plays off the back foot into the covers. He can't pick a single
shorter and wider, Razzaq does well to cut it through the gap between slip and point for one
pushes him back this time and Misbah works it to the off side for one more
worked off the backfoot through point for another single. Pakistan need to step a gear up here. This is a decent recovery
Misbah gets inside the line and misses the glance. Was he really playing a shot there? It goes fine off the pads and they pick a couple of leg byes, so the umpire deemed it an attempted shot.
short and wide outside off and Razzaq whiplashes a cut out to sweeper cover for one
Misbah chips away and makes room to go through the off side. It was full and on the stumps and he pulled out a cover drive into the deep. Can't quite find the gap
slower ball at 110 kph and Razzaq waits to make good contact with the cut. He sent it over the top, but the lack of pace meant it wasn't timed too well. Single to sweeper cover
Misbah plays another one of those poorly timed pull shots, like we saw yesterday. Single to deep midwicket

Razzaq goes bang! Length ball outside off, Razzaq moves the front foot away and launches this into the Abu Dhabi night. It is taken 15 rows behind wide long off. Pity for South Africa, they did not have a fielder there. Monster hit that.

and gone. Anti-climax from Razzaq as he drives a high full toss straight into mid off's hands. Done in by his lack of conviction - he was caught in two minds, unclear whether to go over the top or along the ground. He did neither. Simple catch and Pakistan lose a big wicket
slower ball, comes in sharply as Misbah looks for a late cut. Runs off the pads wide of AB de Villiers and they run a leg bye
Haider reaches well out to cover Tsotsobe's length, but still can't get there. Works it softly to cover
stays back this time to an offcutter and works it into cover, and runs straight down for a nothing run. Misbah sent him back early enough though.

Tsotsobe has hit the moving target here. Haider was not sure which way to go as Tsotsobe slipped in a bouncer. The batsman was going back when the ball came on from back of a length and thudded into his right shoulder.
well, Haider is looking out of his depth here. Runs down the crease to make something happen, but cannot make contact as it whist;es over the stumps from a length
and nearly runs himself out now. Worked straight to cover and he bolts for another risky single. Direct hit would have had him, but Duminy from point missed at the bowlers' end.
gets back and defends to the off side
short and wide outside off and Haider manages to work it behind square and turn the strike over
Misbah jumps across from off stump, looking to get under the lengths, but it is too short and he ends up steering it fine for a single
Haider stays back in the crease and cuts towards the sweeper cover and they pick a couple
inventive edge from Haider who jumps out of the crease, gets a short ball, still looks to steer it and ends up running it very fine on the off side
Misbah tries to get outside leg stump this time and Albie follows him with the line. Misbah has no room to do anything and chips it into his pads
Haider stays beside the line and drives into the covers off the back foot for one more. Where are the boundaries?
perfect yorker just outside off and Misbah can't get under it again. Can only manage to play it back to the bowler. Sickening sound when the ball makes contact with the bottom of the bat.
another laboured pull, almost all the way to the boundary at square leg, but he still can't find a boundary. Misbah has gone into a rut once again.
full and wide outside off and he makes reasonable contact this time, but square drives's sraight to sweeper cover
Haider finally hits the boundary with a workman-like cover drive to a length ball coming in from off stump. Laboured is the word again, but this one was placed to perfection and he got four for it
and the straight drive this time, full on the stumps and Haider punches it well down the ground. Bosman from lon on runs across, slides and saves a couple

At long last, Misbah makes good contact with one. This is what he is good at - using the crease to change the lengths. This was a fullish slower ball, but Misbah went well back and on his knees to get under it and shovel it over midwicket. Lands on the boundary skirting and it is six
and again, Misbah goes back and across to get inside the line and send a length ball sliding towards leg stump, scurrying down to fine leg with a smart little glance
jumps away to the leg side this time and steers a short ball at shoulder height down to third man for a single
Haider does well to turn the strike over. Worked into the covers and off they go for one more
short ball and Misbah continues to time the pull shot. Straight to Tsotsobe at square leg in the circle and they get a single
Morne slips one down the leg and ends up conceding an extra
backs away and inside-outs a half volley outside off over the covers. It is fielded in the deep and he picks a single
Improvisation unlimited from Haider who backs away and goes down on a knee before the ball comes. Fails to make contact though and Misbah remains at the bowlers' end.

lovely shot and superb fielding. Very full on the stumps and Haider did well to stay back and convert it into a half volley. Drives it into the gap in the covers and Duminy had to put in a dive running across from long off. Three runs taken, Misbah to face.

Remember the 2007 World T20 final? Want to see an action replay of the last ball? Here it is. Misbah moves across to off stump, sets himself up for the lap shot. Misbah executes the lap shot. All is hunky dory until he realises he hasn't managed to get it over short fine leg. Sreesanth was half way down to the boundary on that fateful day. Albie was inside the circle today. But Misbah needs to go - stays the same.
From one yorker specialist to another: "See you later." Theron kept it full, it landed close to Gul's toes and crashed into the the base of the stumps as Gul played all over it.
no. It is a length ball outside off and Ajmal manages to work it off the face to the off side for one

Stumps everywhere. Theron hits the castle again, this time it is not a yorker and it did not need to be. Haider looks to slam a length ball on off stump across the line and misses. It crashes into off stump.
